info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 21 at 2:52AM MDT until March 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MDT /7 AM CDT/ THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate Snow expected with blowing snow causing reduction in visibilities as low as one half mile. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas and east central and northeast Colorado. * WHEN...From 6 AM MDT /7 AM CDT/ this morning to 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A mix of rain and snow is expected initially before changing to all snow by mid morning. Wind gusts up to 50 mph are expected and may result in areas of near blizzard conditions at times. Travelers on Interstate 70, Highway 385 in Colorado, Kansas Highway 27 and Highway 36 from Yuma, Colorado to Bird City, Kansas need to be prepared for rapid reductions in visibility if driving due to blowing snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
